titleStmt.title: The Manyema Diary, 1871, Unnumbered Fragment, RHOLAfrs16-1_002_172bv
titleStmt.author: David Livingstone

publicationStmt.pubPlace: London, UK and Los Angeles, California, USA
publicationStmt.publisher: Digital Library Program, University of California, Los Angeles

availability.p: The originals of these documents are held by the Bodleian Library, University of Oxford, which has made them available to the Livingstone Online project. (c) 2011.

msIdentifier.collection: Bodleian Library of Commonwealth and African Studies at Rhodes House, University of Oxford

objectDesc.ab:
Written over:
Envelope Addressed "Dr. Kirk Consulate Zanzibar care of H.M. Commissioner Seychelles"

seal.p: This page has also been embossed with a postal stamp that reads "MAURITIUS A AP 13 69".

projectDesc.p: David Livingstone writes this portion of his diary entries over the recto and verso of an envelope (RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_002r_172br and RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_002v_172bv). This envelope was originally sent to Livingstone along with a separate enclosure (RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_001r_172ar and RHOLMSSAfrs16-1_001v_172av) that Livingstone has also used to record diary entries. Livingstone's text is what is transcribed and represented in the Text Encoding Initiative (TEI) P5 XML encoding. In addition, the present folio bears the handwritten address "Dr. Kirk Consulate Zanzibar care of H.M. Commissioner Seychelles" in a second, unknown hand.

revisionDesc.change: 2011-06-12 Adrian S. Wisnicki initial transcription and XML encoding.

figure.figDesc: Livingstone records a single calculation at the top center of the page
This page is embossed with a postal stamp that reads "MAURITIUS A AP 13 69".
Livingstone covers this page with a series of squiggles to correct ink flow
There are two cancelled one-penny British postal stamps affixed to the page here
